title: Time for a New U.S. Policy in Myanmar
description: It is time that Congress and the Biden administration adopt a new policy to address the ongoing crises in Myanmar by assisting the pro-democracy forces in Myanmar in their efforts to topple the military junta and establish a genuine democratic government.

title: Yoon Seok-youl: What to Expect from South Korea’s Next President
description: Yoon Seok-youl emerged victorious in the South Korean presidential election on March 9. The victory resurrects conservative political forces in Korea that have been struggling to achieve political realignment since the impeachment of Park Geun-hye in 2017.

title: North Korea’s Covid-19 Lockdown: Current Status and Road Ahead
description: A group of experts looked at the impact of Covid-19 on North Korea, including current situation, effects of the border lockdown, broader impact on society and markets, as well as path going forward, possibility of easing restrictions, and feasibility of humanitarian aid.

title: Send Missiles Not Planes
description: The United States and its allies should support Ukraine by expanding on existing weapons transfer programs—specifically by sending missiles instead of planes.

title: A Power Struggle over Ukraine’s Electrical Grid
description: What is fueling the power struggle over Ukraine's electrical grid?

title: China’s Two Sessions: Ready, Aim, Spend
description: China recently announced the 2022 economic growth target would be around 5.5%. The Trustee Chair team analyze the significance of this goal and its implications for other policy priorities.

title: Comments on the U.S. Government’s Indo-Pacific Strategy Paper: Non-security Aspects
description: CSIS senior associate James Wallar comments on how the forthcoming Indo-Pacific Economic Framework can achieve staying power among regional partners.

title: There Is No Time to Spare: Multilateral and Bilateral Economic Support to Ukraine
description: The unprovoked Russian invasion of Ukraine will create a trail of economic destruction and human displacement. Donor countries and multilaterals should use existing tools and mechanisms to support Ukraine.

title: Africa Reacts to the Russian Invasion of Ukraine
description: In the 12th edition of the CSIS Africa Program’s “Africa Reacts” series, thinkers from across the continent analyze the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: Early Lessons for Democracies
description: It is important for democracies to look at the early lessons from what has been done effectively in response to the buildup and invasion in Ukraine.

title: Authoritarian Survival: Venezuelan Gold and Nicaragua’s Ortega-Murillo Regime
description: CSIS Americas senior fellow Ryan C. Berg and Karla Rios assess Nicaragua's role in laundering illegally mined gold from Venezuela and offer recommendations for how the Biden administration can clamp down on this illicit revenue.

title: Why Ukrainian Cities Need Humanitarian Corridors
description: Creating humanitarian corridors in Ukraine will both address the humanitarian need and increase Ukrainian resilience in a protracted conflict.
